TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SecurityElement extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the XML object model for encoding security objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is intended to be a lightweight implementation of a simple XML object model for use within the security system, and not for use as a general XML object model. This documentation assumes a basic knowledge of XML.
The simple XML object model for an element consists of the following parts:
- The tag is the element name.
- The attributes are zero or more name/value attribute pairs on the element.
- The children are zero or more elements nested within `<tag>` and `</tag>`.
It is strongly suggested that attribute based XML representation is used to express security elements and their values. This means properties of an element are expressed as attributes and property values are expressed as attribute values. Avoid nesting text within tags. For any `<tag>text</tag>` representation a representation of type `<tag value="text"/>` is usually available. Using this attribute-based XML representation increases readability and allows easy WMI portability of the resulting XML serialization.
An attribute name must be one character or longer, and cannot be `null`. If element-based value representation is used, elements with a text string that is `null` are represented in the `<tag/>` form; otherwise, text is delimited by the `<tag>` and `</tag>` tokens. Both forms can be combined with attributes, which are shown if present.
The tags, attributes, and text of elements, if present, are always case-sensitive. The XML form contains quotations and escapes where necessary. String values that include characters invalid for use in XML result in an <xref:System.ArgumentException>. These rules apply to all properties and methods.
> [!NOTE] > For performance reasons, character validity is only checked when the element is encoded into XML text form, and not on every set of a property or method. Static methods allow explicit checking where needed.
## Examples The following example shows the use of members of the SecurityElement class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.securi_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.securi_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.securi_1.cs)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `text` parameter is `null` this constructor produces an element identical to the default constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddAttribute (string name, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddAttribute(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a name/value attribute to an XML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Names and values in attributes should only contain valid XML attribute characters. XML attribute names must be unique. Use <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Escape%2A> to remove invalid characters from the string.
There is no support for quoted strings, so strings for name/value pairs should not contain quotes or other characters requiring quoting.
## Examples The following code shows the use of the AddAttribute method to add a name/value attribute to an XML element. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_5_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_5_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_5_1.cs)]

Docs.exception:
The parameter or parameter is invalid in XML.
-or-
An attribute with the name specified by the parameter already exists.

Docs.summary: Adds a child element to the XML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The child element is added following any previously existing child elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string Attribute(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the attribute for which to search.
Docs.summary: Finds an attribute by name in an XML element.
Docs.returns: The value associated with the named attribute, or if no attribute with exists.

remarks.format:
## Remarks With XML as follows, `Attribute("B")` would return "456".
``` <thetag A="123" B="456" C="789">text</thetag> ```
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Attribute method to find an attribute by name. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#13](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_9_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_9_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_9_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attributes of an XML element as name/value pairs.
Docs.value: The object for the attribute values of the XML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each attribute is stored in the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> as a name/value pair.
Names and values in attributes should contain only valid XML attribute characters. Use <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Escape%2A> to remove invalid characters from the string.
There is no support for quoted strings, so strings for name/value pairs should not contain quotes or other characters requiring quoting.
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Attributes property to get an attribute of an XML element. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#15](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.securi_3_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.securi_3_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.securi_3_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The name or value of the object is invalid.
The name is not a valid XML attribute name.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the array of child elements of the XML element.
Docs.value: The ordered child elements of the XML element as security elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> contains both <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Text%2A> and Children, <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Text%2A> will appear first.

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current object.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The copy includes both the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Children%2A> and <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Attributes%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Equal(class System.Security.SecurityElement other) cil managed

Docs.param: An XML element object to which to compare the current XML element object.
Docs.summary: Compares two XML element objects for equality.
Docs.returns: if the tag, attribute names and values, child elements, and text fields in the current XML element are identical to their counterparts in the parameter; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there are child elements, comparison extends recursively to them.
There is no support for comparing different XML representations of the same characters.
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Equal method to compare two XML elements. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#22](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_6_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#22](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_6_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#22](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_6_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Escape(string str) cil managed

Docs.param: The string within which to escape invalid characters.
Docs.summary: Replaces invalid XML characters in a string with their valid XML equivalent.
Docs.returns: The input string with invalid characters replaced.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to replace invalid characters in a string before using the string in a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement>. If invalid characters are used in a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> without being escaped, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
The following table shows the invalid XML characters and their escaped equivalents.
|invalid XML Character|Replaced With| |---------------------------|-------------------| |"\<"|"<"| |">"|">"| |"\\""|"""| |"\\'"|"'"| |"&"|"&"|
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Escape method to replace invalid XML characters in a string with their valid XML equivalent. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#19](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_7_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#19](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_7_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#19](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_7_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.SecurityElement FromString(string xml) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML-encoded string from which to create the security element.
Docs.summary: Creates a security element from an XML-encoded string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Do not use single quotation marks in the XML string; instead, use escaped double quotation marks. For example, instead of "`<value name='Company'>Microsoft</value>"` use "`<value name=\"Company\">Microsoft</value>"`.
Using single quotation marks can result in either an exception being thrown or, in some cases, the single quotation marks being treated as text in the string.

Docs.exception: contains one or more single quotation mark characters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.SecurityElement SearchForChildByTag(string tag) cil managed

Docs.param: The tag for which to search in child elements.
Docs.summary: Finds a child by its tag name.
Docs.returns: The first child XML element with the specified tag value, or if no child element with exists.

remarks.format:
## Remarks With XML as follows, `SearchForChildByTag("second")` would return the child element `<second>`.
``` <thetag A="123" B="456" C="789"> <first>text1</first> <second>text2</second></thetag> ```
## Examples The following code shows the use of the SearchForChildByTag method to find a child by its tag name. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#17](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_1_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#17](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#17](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_1_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string SearchForTextOfTag(string tag) cil managed

Docs.param: The tag for which to search in child elements.
Docs.summary: Finds a child by its tag name and returns the contained text.
Docs.returns: The text contents of the first child element with the specified tag value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is equivalent to the following:
[!code-vb[System.Security.SecurityElement#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_0_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Security.SecurityElement#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Security.SecurityElement#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_0_1.cs)]
With XML as follows, `SearchForTextOfTag("second")` would return "text2".
``` <thetag A="123" B="456" C="789"> <first>text1</first> <second>text2</second></thetag> ```
## Examples The following code shows the use of the SearchForTextOfTag method to find a child by its tag name and return the contained text. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#18](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.securi_0_2.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#18](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.securi_0_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#18](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.securi_0_2.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the tag name of an XML element.
Docs.value: The tag name of an XML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In XML, the tag appears in the script as appears below:
``` <tag attributes>text</tag> ```
If this element has child elements, the children will replace `text`.
Assign only valid XML tag strings to this property. Use <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Escape%2A> to remove invalid characters from the string.
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Tag property to get the tag name of an XML element. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.securi_1_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#11](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.securi_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.securi_1_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The tag is not valid in XML.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text within an XML element.
Docs.value: The value of the text within an XML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The text should not contain XML special characters. Use <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Escape%2A> to remove invalid characters from the string.
If a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> contains both Text and <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement.Children%2A>, Text will appear first.
## Examples The following code shows the use of the Text property to get the text of an XML element. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class.
[!code-vb[SecurityElementMembers#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.securi_2_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[SecurityElementMembers#12](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.securi_2_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SecurityElementMembers#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.securi_2_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The text is not valid in XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Produces a string representation of an XML element and its constituent attributes, child elements, and text.
Docs.returns: The XML element and its contents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is useful in debugging to see the XML representation of the element.
